name: India
takeaway: The impact of the June 2020 border clashes between India and PRC has dramatically changed the relationship and continues to play a major role in defining the relationship between the PRC and India. That incident has had major impacts on all Domains and has significantly reduced the footprint of the PRC in India.

There seems to be a persistent tactic by the PRC to use the Indian Media through advertorials and friendly left-leaning media to highlight development in the PRC, and to some extent compare it with the state of developments in India.

With the development of partnerships between Indian companies and Chinese companies and the "Make in India" promotion by the Indian goverment, complicated partnership structures present a challenge to clearly understanding influence. For example: Hikvision operates India as Prama Hikvision India Private Ltd and Prama also operates as Prama India, omitting mention of Hikvision and operates with taglines like, "Made for India, Made by India, Made in India".
description-1: In 2023, India had a GDP per capita of US$2,485 and a total population of 1,431.70 million people.
description-2: India established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1950. India was ranked 159th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 66/100.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.note: "No media groups or journalists are members of the project however, the Indian Express and Financial Express published special page on the Third Belt and Road Forum for International Cooperation."
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence:
Indian journalists Manogya Loiwal, Suraj Pandey and Rajiv Lodha as part of the delegation visited China and were hosted at the Foreign Ministry in China. 
At the same time, in the last year or so, there have been a number of Youtubers(online influences) who have traveled to China, however there is no evidence that it was organized or sponsored. 
As such, this indicator is rated as few but insignificant based on the lack of a huge number of Journalists or Media organizations present in india. At the same time, the content from the Youtubers doesn't echo China's state narratives and tend to be critical of elements around authoritarianism and state security mechanims.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.note: Before the 2020 Border clashes, there were cases of journalists receiving training as well as publishing of propaganda peices, however after the 2020 border clashes and non-renewal of Visa for journalist in tit-for-tat escalation, there is no evidence of such training.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: China Radio International (CRI) which is the Chinese state-owned broadcaster produces radio news in Hindi, Bengali and Tamil targeting India. CRI also produces video and text news delivered through their websites and social media. However the reason for assigning an insignificant rating to this indicator is that based on the population and the number of media houses that are currently operating in India, CRI doesn't have any significant reach.
Media.note: This Indicator only refers to PRC state media directly broadcasted or distributed by PRC entities. In other words, it may include YouTube channels in the domestic language run by CGTN (a state media organization) or local TV channels run by CCTV. This Indicator does not cover Chinese state media that is shared indirectly by domestic media outlets (content-sharing agreements). That phenomenon is covered in Media Indicator #7.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.note: They are few reports on Indian media group receiving funds from China, however, many critics says that reasons behind the raids such as the ones at NewsClick was purely intentional as it has been publishing news critical of the current government. However, there is no indication that any of these media are wholly or marjority owned by PRC-connected individuals or entities.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon, however there are cases of articles published on Indian media which reflect some of the propaganda of PRC such as on 27th July 2023, the Charge d'Affairs of the Chinese Embassy wrote an article in The Hindu, 'The SCO is a success story that can get better'.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: In continuation of the trends observed in the previous years, there has been a steady stream of Advertorial published on major Indian Newspapers such as the celebration of the 74th Anniversary of the Founding of the People' Republic of China on September 28th, 2023 on The Indian Express and the Financial Express. The reason for this being significant is partly due to the persistent nature of such content and the wide reach of these national papers.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: In April, 2023, the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs decided to “freeze” the visas of two Indian journalists reporting from China – The Hindu‘s Ananth Krishnan and Prasar Bharati’s Anshuman Mishra and in June, 2023, visa's for other Indian Journalists in China were rejected and had to leave China.
Media.note: The case could be made that this was a public spat between India and China and not directly related to pressure exerted on the Journalists, however whatever the rationale might be, there is definate pressure.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence:
We chose to skip this question because we couldn't locate a specific case that describe the relationship with PRC on the set conditions, howwever, there are instances when certain news organizations feature PRC news on their media platforms and even publish special reports commemorating PRC anniversaries.
TheHindu is a national paper which is left-leaning and has published article on PRC in positive terms but that would not constitute emotive language per se due to which we are skipping this section.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Media.note: Eventhough, they are some papers, editorials which somewhat echo certain PRC talking points and even extol the development initiatives, there is no evidence of the same on denial of the existence of re-educating camps or whitewashing human rights abuses.

Foreign Policy.evidence: Eventhough there is an India-China Parliamentary Friendship Group, however the membership list doesn't reflect that it is a joint group as such the indicator deserves a "no" response.
Foreign Policy.note: Although in some countries, parliamentary structure does not allow for such groups or committees, we still consider this indicator as important. "Joint parliamentary friendship group" means joint as PRC and target country representatives.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Foreign Policy.note: Bilateral relations have been adversely impacted by incidents along the Line of Actual Control (LAC) in Eastern Ladakh in April-May 2020. Due to this India has not signed any form of agreement with the PRC since 2020.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: India has stuck by the "One China Policy". For India, the "One China Policy" doesn’t just govern Taiwan but also Tibet. India doesn’t recognize Taiwan or any Tibetan authority as independent of China. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.note: The "One China principle" is the position held by the PRC and the CCP that there is only one sovereign state under the name China, with the PRC serving as the sole legitimate government of that China, and Taiwan is an inalienable part of China. Under its "one China policy", the U.S. acknowledges the PRC position on Taiwan, but does not take a stance on its validity. Here "my country's own 'one China policy'" is used as an umbrella term for foreign policy formulations similar to the U.S. one China policy that differ from the PRC's one China principle.   https://www.us-taiwan.org/resources/faq-the-united-states-one-china-policy-is-not-the-same-as-the-prc-one-china-principle/
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: In the case of the South China Sea arbitration, it has abided by the ruling issued by the UNCLOS which was against China. At the same time, India has opposed China's territorial claims over parts of India. Therefore, the Index country has rejected the PRC’s territorial claim and the Indicator warrants a 0 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No evidence can be found of the Index country taking a definitive position regarding this Indicator. Therefore, the Index country has remained silent regarding the PRC’s treatment of its Uyghur population and the Indicator warrants a 2 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No evidence can be found of the Index country taking a definitive position regarding this Indicator. Therefore, the Index country has remained silent regarding the PRC’s treatment of its Tibet population and the Indicator warrants a 2 score.
Foreign Policy.note: India has officially remained silent on the treatment of the Tibetan people by the PRC, however it must be understood that India has supported the Tibetans diaspora for decades in their religious, language and cultural preservation.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No evidence can be found of the Index country taking a definitive position regarding this Indicator. Therefore, the Index country has remained silent regarding the PRC’s ongoing repression in Hong Kong and the Indicator warrants a 2 score.

Academia.evidence: There are a few Confucius Institutes in Indian Universities as listed in links and as such the indicator deserves a "few" rating. However due to the sheer number of universities in India and the fact the number of such institues numbering less than a dozen makes the impact of such institutes "insignificant". At the same time, after the 2020 border clashes, there has been enhanced scrutiny on the functioning of such institutes.
Academia.note: In recent years, some Confucius Institutes have been renamed or rebranded, but still maintain connections with the CCP. This Indicator includes Chinese language centers that operate in the same manner as Confucius Institutes. It does not include Chinese language centers that merely offer exchanges to PRC-based language institutes (language exchanges). See this report: https://www.universityworldnews.com/post.php?story=20220630152610783
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence:
In the past individual scholars or scholars affiliated with government institutes or think tanks may have visited China. These days scholars affiliated with state and central universities are required to get permission from the Union External Affairs Ministry. 
For instance, the upcoming function in Peking University, one of the top institutions in the People's Republic of China, plans to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Rabindranath Tagore's visit to the institution with a symposium on him and his global vision in May this year.  For this, Chinese Consul General Zha Liyou in Calcutta is coordinating the visit of a few scholars and Tagore researchers to Peking in May 2024. 
This indicators deserves a few and insignificant rating because of the forementioned challenges to these kind of trips.

This indicator is to measure the sub-national or city level partnership, if an agreements is signed at the national level on behalf of the local government, the answer to this indicator should be positive.

As such this indicator has a few but insignificant rating.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Some Indian politicians or govt employees publicly echoed PRCs talking points. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "insignificant" rating.

Technology.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence:
In 2018, the DoT had excluded companies like Huawei and ZTE from participating in trials to develop 5G use cases in India. For national security reasons, in Dec, 2020, India's National Security Directive (NSDTC) mandated service providers to purchase equipment from“trusted sources”. With immediate effect from 15th June 2021, new restrictions for providing licenses have been implemented. License shall only connect trusted products in its network and also seek permission from designated authority for up-gradation or expansion of existing Network.
Since then, Indian telecoms have signed agreements with non-PRC enterprises such as Nokia, Ericsson, Samsung for upgrading or laying out new networks.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Technology.note: The national security concerns for India after the border clash with PRC in 2020 resulted in top-down restrictions for PRC-connected entities to operate in India. Government facilitated service providers were mandated to not use Chinese equipment in their facilities.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Technology.note: The Indian government stresses on not using Chinese made components for critical infrastructures such as military and security equipments.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence:
If you look at the market share for home surveilliance technology in India, more than 65% is by PRC companies, however there is no indication that central or local governments have signed any new agreements as the backlash faced by both Central and State governments of issuing contracts to PRC firms have been huge due to current stalemate situation in the border.
As such, there is a security issue with regards to how much market share PRC-connected entities have in India with regards to surveilliance technology in the domestic market.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Although, India has attracted Chinese investors in its “smart city” systems in the last decade before 2020, however since the 2020 border clashes, there are no reports of such contracts given to PRC-connected entities.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Technology.note: India emphasized the need of fiber optic for increased protection from foreign interception as well as faster communication in the remote areas. To counter this, the government is actively working on different initiatives and developing indigenous core technologies for strengthening the fiber optics. India manufactures 100 million fiber km every year. In comparison to manufacturing capacity, the domestic annual consumption of fiber optic is less than half of manufacturing capacity 46 million fiber km. 16 Million FKM of Optical fibers has been exported annually to more than 100 countries in the last three years. Over the years, the country has not only emerged as a manufacturing hub for optical fiber but also as a world exporter of high quality optical fiber to advanced economies in Europe, Americas and other regions across the globe.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: This indicator deserves a 'few' rating based on the total foreign investments in technology startups in relation to investments from PRC-affliated entities. As such, the indicator is deemed as insignificant as the exposure is minimal with regards to investment. After the 2020 border clash, there hasn't been any significant changes in terms of investments.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: After the 2020 border clashes with the PRC, MOUs signed between PRC-connected entities and Indian companies were put on hold and since then, there is no indication that anything has changed since then.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Back in 2014, India has signed a space cooperation pact and have collaborated, however the current state of that pact is not clear based on roadblocks in terms of collaboration after the 2020 border clashes. As such, we have decided to skip this indicator.
Technology.note:
The India-China space competition also has a security angle. India had previously expressed worries over China’s technological advancement in space-technology, citing it as more than a military concern – one that transcends to include national infrastructure too.
India's space priorities are shifting toward national security. India is also building partnerships with other states to counter China’s prowess.  New Delhi has established or strengthened space security partnerships not only with the Quadrilateral Security Dialogue (the Quad, which also includes the United States, Japan, Australia), but also with France and others. While its bilateral partnerships with Japan, France, and the United States have involved both civil and security developments, the Quad as a group has also emphasized consultations on norms of responsible behavior and regulations, with an eye clearly.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Technology.note: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon as India uses Its The Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System (IRNSS). After the border clash of 2020 with PRC, the PRC themselves restricted the use of its BeiDou system along borders with India.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is a Chinese community based in Tangra, Kolkata that celebrates Lunar New Year every year, however there is no linkage to show that these events are sponsored by PRC linked personnel.
Society.note: In 2015, an Indian think tank from Kolkata organised a visit from a Chinese delegation comprising GT personnel. They were taken to Tangra, the China town in Kolkata. I was present there as I was the interpreter. The diaspora in Tangra is mainly third or fourth generation and hardly speaks Mandarin. The Chinese side did ask me to ask them if they missed the 'motherland', the answer to which was "India is the motherland". There have been some of these visits, which, while not coordinated by the UFWD, still do take place. Influence operations in India follow a different model and not the one recognised in the West/East. There is no coverage in the media of this mentioned visit. However, I was present there when the event took place. (Expert Reviewer Note)
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Military.note: PRC has provided India with satellite data on India's flood-hit regions to assist its flood relief efforts as well as exported 3,800 tonnes of medical supplies and over 26,000 ventilators to India in April, 2021 to help fight the surging Covid-19 pandemic in the country. However, PLA was not involved based on the data availabel.

Military.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Military.note: India provides military training to other countries to counter China's influence.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence:
On April 27, 2023 Shri Rajnath Singh met State Councillor and Minister of National Defence of China General Li Shangfu in New Delhi. At the same time, since the 2020 border clash, there has been at-least 20 rounds of talk. As such, this indicator response is "more than few" rating and insignificant as there has been no resolution to the border issue after all the bilateral talks and meetings.
At the same time, talks have also been conducted under the framework of the Working Mechanism for Consultation and Coordination on India-China Border Affairs(WMCC) and the latest was the 28th meeting held on 30th November, 2023 with agreements on continuation of talks.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: This indicator cannot be applied to India as it shares a border with China and after the 2020 border clashes, there has been a number of meetings to de-escalate the situation and as such on both sides, they have been advocates for a friendly/peaceful resolution as well as being aggressive and taking a strong stand. As such, this is based on a situation and not about cooperation in the larger context.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: India took part in “Peace mission exercise drills” along with PLA and Pakistan army, which was conducted in Russia in Sept 2023 and has participated in other exercises such as "Vostok-2022" and "Zapad exercise"(2021). Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Military.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: India doesn't have any extradition treaty with PRC, however it has a extradtion treaty currently in force with Hong Kong and after the passing of the National Security Law in Hong Kong which has worldwide criminal jurisdiction, the treaty with Hong Kong can serve as de-facto treaty with PRC with regards to extradition.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: India hasn't solely signed cooperative agreements with the PRC. However it is one of the member states as part of SCO(Shanghai Cooperation Organisation) was the Chair of SCO- Regional Anti-Terrorist Structure in 2021-2022.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
Law Enforcement.note: There are cases of Chinese individuals linked to Hawala Racket(Money Transfer Method outside the Tradtional Banking Sytem) operating in India and might have links to PRC-connected gangs but they don't operate in India directly.

Law Enforcement.evidence: Over the last few years, there has been a series of cyber attacks targeting government, critical infrastructure and enterprises from PRC based actors. The attacks have been numerous and have targeted multiple sectors be it government, private, critical infrastructure and as such, these are significant in terms of the impact they have on these sectors.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon in the last two years, however previously they were cases of activists being arbitrarily detained at the behest of PRC before state visits of PRC officials to India such as when Xi Jinping visited India in 2019.

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon

Law Enforcement.evidence: There is no case/story to show that law enforcement has deployed surveillance systems from PRC(such as a contract listed publicly), however Hikvision has the largest market share in India through Prama Hikivision India Private Limited and through Prama India Private Limited and regularly participates in expo's in India showcasing their surveillaince system where law enforcement take part. However, we were unable to find concrete proof that law enforcements have deployed such systems from PRC.
